name: Twice Baked Potatoes
description: Twice baked potatoes are the ultimate comfort food featuring fluffy mashed potatoes, bacon, cheddar cheese, and more delicious toppings.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp salt + a pinch to season the potato skins ($0.05)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Wash and dry the potatoes well, then use a fork to prick each potato several times.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Wash and dry the potatoes well, then use a fork to prick each potato several times.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the potatoes on a parchment lined baking sheet. Drizzle the olive oil over the potatoes, then use your hands or a silicone brush to brush the oil over each potato until it is fully coated. Season the potatoes with a pinch of salt.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the potatoes on a parchment lined baking sheet. Drizzle the olive oil over the potatoes, then use your hands or a silicone brush to brush the oil over each potato until it is fully coated. Season the potatoes with a pinch of salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes, or until the potatoes can be pierced easily with a fork. Total baking time will depend on the size of your potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in the preheated oven for 50-60 minutes, or until the potatoes can be pierced easily with a fork. Total baking time will depend on the size of your potatoes.

recipeInstructions.text: While the potatoes are baking, cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until brown and crispy. Remove the cooked bacon from the skillet and allow it to drain on a paper-towel lined plate. Once cool enough to handle, rough chop the bacon into smaller pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: While the potatoes are baking, cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until brown and crispy. Remove the cooked bacon from the skillet and allow it to drain on a paper-towel lined plate. Once cool enough to handle, rough chop the bacon into smaller pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the potatoes are done baking, remove them from the oven and allow them to cool slightly. When the potatoes are cool enough to handle, slice them in half lengthwise. Carefully scoop out the potato flesh, leaving a thin rim of potato (about ¼ inch rim) around the edges to help the skin hold its shape.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the potatoes are done baking, remove them from the oven and allow them to cool slightly. When the potatoes are cool enough to handle, slice them in half lengthwise. Carefully scoop out the potato flesh, leaving a thin rim of potato (about ¼ inch rim) around the edges to help the skin hold its shape.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the scooped out potato flesh in a large bowl and add the butter, sour cream, milk, salt, and pepper. Use a potato masher or hand mixer to blend the potatoes until light and fluffy.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the scooped out potato flesh in a large bowl and add the butter, sour cream, milk, salt, and pepper. Use a potato masher or hand mixer to blend the potatoes until light and fluffy.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chopped bacon, half of the sliced green onions, and 1/2 cup of the shredded cheddar cheese to the mashed potatoes, then fold to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chopped bacon, half of the sliced green onions, and 1/2 cup of the shredded cheddar cheese to the mashed potatoes, then fold to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the potato skins with about 1/3 cup of the potato mixture, then sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese over the top of each potato.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill the potato skins with about 1/3 cup of the potato mixture, then sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese over the top of each potato.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the potatoes in the oven a second time, just until heated through and the cheddar cheese is melted on top, about 20 minutes. Top with the remaining green onions and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the potatoes in the oven a second time, just until heated through and the cheddar cheese is melted on top, about 20 minutes. Top with the remaining green onions and enjoy!

review.reviewBody: My whole family loved these. Thank you Marsha :)
I made this recipe earlier the morning I needed them. I let them sit at room temperature until I needed them for dinner and then reheated them and they were very good!

I have to comment on these because they were so easy and completely delicious.  My picky 8 year old asked for seconds!  Marsha, you are an absolute gem and I’ve loved every one of your recipes I’ve made.  Thank you!
On the spur of the moment I was looking for a recipe for twice baked potatoes.  I made these tonight and they were really good.  Thank you, Marsha, for sharing your recipes.

What a great recipe, easy and delicious. I made the regular version and a vegan version. My daughter loved the vegan potatoes and the rest of us felt the same about the non vegan ones. Glad to know these can be made ahead. I like Janmaus's comment about using smaller potatoes. Smaller portions would be good for a potluck where there is plenty of other food. I couldn't eat a full large size one but that's okay, leftovers! Will be making these again.
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! And easier than I thought. I followed the recipe exactly and it cme out perfect. Would highly recommend everyone to try!
